abusenius - (12:39): hello everyone  
abusenius - (12:40): does somebody know where web/\*\*/webapp/templates/\*wysiwyg.vm are used?  
sdumitriu - (12:40): Hi abusenius  
sdumitriu - (12:40): The old WYSIWYG editor  
abusenius - (12:40): files like attachwysiwyg.vm  
abusenius - (12:40): is it still supported?  
sdumitriu - (12:41): Not really  
sdumitriu - (12:41): It's slowly dying  
sdumitriu - (12:41): But we can't remove it yet  
abusenius - (12:41): maybe they should also be removed then? they have some security issues  
abusenius - (12:41): why not?  
abusenius - (12:44): those files (or at least some of them) don't seem to be used any more, but are still in the package by default and can be mis-used  
sdumitriu - (12:50): vmassol: When do we completely remove the 1.0 WYSIWYG?  
lucaa left at 12:53 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds

SvenDowideit joined #xwiki at 12:59  
vmassol - (13:00): sdumitriu: hmm good question… not before we convert all pages in 1.0 syntax I believe. And we probably need to leave time for users who have not migrated to 2.0 syntax yet. I'd say maybe for XWiki 3.0  
vmassol - (13:01): (XWiki 3.0 is the extension manager for me - we need to define this and agree of course)  
arkub joined #xwiki at 13:43  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 13:45  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:55  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 14:00  
DSpair joined #xwiki at 14:01  
DSpair - (14:02): Good day all. In XWiki Syntax 2.0, how would I link to an attachment on a different page/space?  
vmassol - (14:02): hi DSpair  
vmassol - (14:02): [[label>>attach:Space.Page@filename]]  
DSpair - (14:03): Good morning Vincent  
DSpair - (14:03): Ahh, thank you sir!  
vmassol - (14:04): good point, we need to add this to the syntax page  
tmortagne - (14:05): DSpair: note that when you don't know how to do something in xwiki/2.0 syntax the WYSIWYG probably know how to do it so you can look at what the WYSIWYG generated in the source  
vmassol - (14:06): (I'm adding it to the syntax page now)  
DSpair - (14:08): Hrrmmm . . . Looks like the panels still use 1.0 syntax on my version of XWiki.  
DSpair - (14:08): And panels don't have a WYSIWYG editor tmortagne.  
tmortagne - (14:09): DSpair: i mean do that in another test page  
DSpair - (14:09): tmortagne: Oh, good point.  
tmortagne - (14:09): i only suggested to look how WYSIWYG do thing when you don't know not to use the WYSIWYG all the time  
tmortagne - (14:10): btw it seems wrong to me that you don't have WYSIWYG when inline editing a panel  
tmortagne - (14:10): if the panel is xwiki/2.0 of course  
tmortagne - (14:11): panel class probably have a wrong configuration for the content field since it's possible to have WYSIWYG for object fields AFAIK  
DSpair - (14:13): Hmmm . . . Seems like I have all sorts of problems with panels. The panels on my XWiki (1.9.3) are in XWiki 1.0 syntax, but I cannot get the "attach" macro to work.  
tmortagne - (14:14): DSpair: if the atatchement is on the panel it's probably the reason, a panels is executed with the main document as contexte document so if you don't indicate explicitely the panel as document where to find the attachement if will probably not work  
DSpair - (14:14): Nevermind, I fat fingered. It's working now.  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 14:16  
vmassol - (14:18): DSpair: it's now documented here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HLinks  
DSpair - (14:20): Thanks Vincent!
